channel.title: Linux Distro to choose
channel.description: Hey, I was wondering which which linux distro i should pick. I'm leaning towards Fedora 10, but I'm not really sure which to choose. If you could make some suggestions, it would be highly appreciated.

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:48, topic:272074”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=358979.msg2746742#msg2746742 date=1239667743]
Ok. So no that I’ve limited it to Ubuntu, which is better? The original Ubuntu, Or Kubuntu, or does it just depend on personal preference?
[/quote]

Bear in mind that its not hard to switch between them until you decide. You can install the “xubuntu-desktop” and “kubuntu-desktop” packages from normal ubuntu and basically have all three, choose which one you want to use (from xfce/gnome/kde) when you login, and then remove the others when you make your desicion, if you have the hd space and patience.[/quote]

Thanks. I’m going to have PLENTY of space, and patience.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 20, 2009, 04:19:49 pm[/size][hr]Ok. Am I going to have any hardware compatibility issues? Like with the Graphics card or anything?

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Mopman:

If the hypothetical beginner can handle it and knows how to ask questions properly and when to RTFM or google it, they’ll learn 10x faster with it though

Yes but if that were true with most people, moparscape would be a much different place.

I mean I didn’t know much about Linux when I tried Arch, I did however have the sense to google and use the enormous wiki. That can’t be said for everyone though >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

zyle1992:

Ok. So no that I’ve limited it to Ubuntu, which is better? The original Ubuntu, Or Kubuntu, or does it just depend on personal preference?

Bear in mind that its not hard to switch between them until you decide. You can install the “xubuntu-desktop” and “kubuntu-desktop” packages from normal ubuntu and basically have all three, choose which one you want to use (from xfce/gnome/kde) when you login, and then remove the others when you make your desicion, if you have the hd space and patience.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cooper wrote:

zyle1992:

does it just depend on personal preference?

Yes

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Sorry but there is nothing wrong with RPM, I used to hate it and then I actually used it, wasn’t so bad.

Besides, Fedora has yum, so it makes it a little more pleasant.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

zyle1992:

Ok, so I’ve got alot of reasons to choose Ubuntu, or Kubuntu. But are there any negatives of choosing Fedora 10? Not saying i’m going to use Fedora 10, but I want to know what peoples experiences have been using it. What they like about it, what they didn’t, etc.

The fact that RPM package management is horrible is the reason I wouldn’t go with Fedora. Have a peek here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/pkgmanager/

Dpkg (debian, ubuntu, others) is the way to go, from my experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

I tried the KDE version once and sound didn’t work so I got rid of it. Installing proprietary stuff is a pain also(it was either flash or the nvidia driver)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:37, topic:272074”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=358979.msg2744670#msg2744670 date=1239557801]
Worse or the same, depends; it is not better. Also, I know the value of a Euro -> USD (approx 1.5 * eu)
[/quote]

I never said euro, unless your computer displays “Shift 3” as the euro sign. I meant 779GBP which i now calulated to be 1143USD.[/quote]
£ != € Whoops…

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:35, topic:272074”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=358979.msg2744357#msg2744357 date=1239547499]

A) The processors/other hardware is the SAME as any standard PC

A) The processors/other hardware is WORSE as any standard PC

Why would anyone pay £779 (cba to convert to $) for a 2.4GHz Intel Core 2 Duo processor and ATI Radeon HD 2400 XT with 128Mb of GDDR3 memory.

A average PC 4 years ago had 128mb of memory (GDDR3 isnt too bad)

[/quote]No, its the same, just way more expensive.[/quote]
Worse or the same, depends; it is not better. Also, I know the value of a Euro -> USD (approx 1.5 * eu)

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

T4_:

Not to mention I HATE how ‘artists’ say Macs are best for graphical design. A) The processors/other hardware is the SAME as any standard PC, B) The programs (Photoshop, etc) are multi-platform, C) The OS isn’t any ‘faster’ than a Windows (generalizing here) machine.

For some peoples its true. For example, for audio stuff (not sure if you included that under artists) Logic is pretty much the defacto DAW (well, except pro tools, btu thats not really accessible to home/small studios) and Logic only runs on macs.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

They are not as fast or secure as linux, and ‘pretty’ is a matter of opinion, I think KDE 3.5 is the prettiest of all

To me, Mac’s are ugly pieces of crap.

Also, I know you’re interested in KDE 4.2: http://adymo.blogspot.com/2009/01/kde4-review-from-inside-out-part-1.html

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Tell me about it, lots of people I know try to tell me Macs are the best thing in the world because they are: ‘fast, secure, and look pretty’. So, I ask them how it works and if they could take it apart; they don’t know.

Not to mention I HATE how ‘artists’ say Macs are best for graphical design. A) The processors/other hardware is the SAME as any standard PC, B) The programs (Photoshop, etc) are multi-platform, C) The OS isn’t any ‘faster’ than a Windows (generalizing here) machine.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

True, those are the worst.

Read full topic

item.description:

I’ll agree that it has a lot of bad users, but it also has a lot of very helpful and good users. And I think we all would agree that a bad ubuntu user is better than any windows user right?

Or a Mac user shivers.

item.title: Linux Distro to choose
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I’m coming to like Ubuntu more and more lately. Can’t really find fault with it other than its a bit sluggish on older machines. It’s not a bad distro, it just has a lot of bad users
